messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker?
ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker is a simple node designed to filter out NSFW outputs in ComfyUI.
Which model does ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker use for NSFW detection?
ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker utilizes the AdamCodd/vit-base-nsfw-detector model for scoring the outputs.
Why was the AdamCodd/vit-base-nsfw-detector model chosen for ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker?
The AdamCodd/vit-base-nsfw-detector model was chosen because it is small, fast, and performed very well in testing.
What is the default threshold setting for ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker?
The default threshold setting for ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker is 0.8, which is considered a safe baseline.
What are the inputs and outputs of ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker?
ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker has 1 image input, 1 image output, a string output, a threshold slider, and a CUDA toggle.
What does the image output of ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker show?
The image output of ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker will output black unless the input falls below the selected threshold.
What is the purpose of the string output in ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker?
The string output in ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker outputs the score given to the image, intended to be used with a show text node to adjust the threshold setting.
What does the CUDA toggle in ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker do?
The CUDA toggle in ComfyUI-YetAnotherSafetyChecker allows the model to be loaded on the GPU for faster processing.
